data.name: Robot Vacuum Cleaner
data.description:
# Description
Imagine you have a robot vacuum cleaner that cleans squares on a grid. You need to make a function that returns the total number of squares cleaned. ***Note: there is no limit on how much the robot cleans, the size of the grid is infinite.***

## Input
Valid input will be of type string containing a sequence of either `U`, `D`, `L`, or `R` (Up, Down, Left, Right), or `null`. Invalid input (type is not string or null or not `'UDLR'` characters in string) is expected to throw a `TypeError`. Function should be **case-insensitive**.

Be sure to remember that input **can and will be** optional in the tests. (`vacuum()`)

### Valid input examples:
- `'UDLR'`
- `'UU'`
- `'DDDLRLLRD'`
- `'udlrllrd'`
- `undefined` (`vacuum()`)

### Invalid input examples:
- `1234`
- `'hello'`
- `':)'`
- `['U', 'D', 'L', 'R']`
- `{1: 'U', 2: 'D', 3: 'L'}`
- `['foo', 12, 'bar', {}, 'bazzz']`

## Output
Total number of tiles cleaned, or error.

If the input is incorrect (wrong type or not `U`, `D`, `L`, or `R` in the string) throw a `TypeError`.

# Examples

Red numbers denote each move

### `vacuum()`
=> 1

[Grid](https://i.imgur.com/rqGVseu.jpg)

### `vacuum('U')`
=> 2

[Grid](https://i.imgur.com/9ypAMpj.jpg)

### `vacuum('UDLL')`
=> 4

[Grid](https://i.imgur.com/KeraqPM.jpg)

### `vacuum('DDUDLRLU')`
=> 4

[Grid](https://i.imgur.com/Q6l2h7m.jpg)

### `vacuum('RRRRDDL')`
=> 8

[Grid](https://i.imgur.com/V1IkZOi.jpg)
